page.title: 18FINZEAN DOMESTIC BUILDINGS.
page.content: {Finzean House},burnt down in 1953 was rebuilt to smaller proportions but is still the largest dwelling house,the oldest parts dating from 1686.Another old house,{Tillyfruskie,}dating from 1733, is being restored for the farm grieve.{Nether Tillygarmond}is the only other house over 200 years old. {Bogieshiel,}on Ballogie, is being modernised by one of the Nicol Bros. {Most houses,}erected in the latter part of the 19th century, are detached granite built with slated roofs. Bathrooms with piped water and indoor sanitation were added 1950-70 after electricity transformed domestic life in the area. During the past 20 years,{ten new {houses}have been built in addition to {a sheltered housing scheme of eight {houses}for the elderly.
